pages.text: Asteracanthus is hybodont shark from the Jurassic to Cretaceous, with some dubious records from earlier periods. Even though it was about 3m, it is known from a very well-preserved mostly complete specimen from Solnhofen. Its teeth suggest a durophagous diet, consisting of hard-shelled animals, and it probably had a benthic ecology.
